thread.title: Thanksgiving Dinner in Chicago

title: Thanksgiving Dinner in Chicago
text:
Updated Articles and Resources 
Traveling to Chicago over Thanksgiving but don't have anywhere to pull up to the table for Thanksgiving Dinner? Don't worry, you won't be stuck eating peanuts out of the mini-bar, there are several great restaurants in the city that will be open and serving up Thanksgiving eats.Listed prices generally do not include alcoholic beverages or gratuity, unless otherwise noted. All prices/hours/food offerings are subject to change, so it's best to call ahead. BIN 36 
The oenophile in your life will probably vote for Thanksgiving dinner at BIN 36, one of Chicago's premiere wine destinations. Chef John Caputo is putting out a three course feast with sides served family style, paired with wine director Brian Duncan's expertly matched wine selections. Address: 339 N. Dearborn St., Chicago Phone: 312-755-9410 Thanksgiving Hours: 3:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. Cost: Adults: $48; Children 5-12: $20 Chicago Cut Steakhouse 
Chicago Cut Steakhouse isn't getting to adventurous with their Thanksgiving dinner with offerings like maple-glazed roast turkey and basil-whipped potatoes, but they make up for it with a great view of the Chicago River. The restaurant's full a la carte menu offerings will be available as well. Address: 300 N. LaSalle St., Chicago Phone: 312-329-1800 Thanksgiving Hours: 12:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. Cost: Adults: $40; Children 2-12: $20 Custom House Tavern 
Nestled at the bottom of the Hotel Blake, Custom House Tavern is giving its refined rustic sensibility to the Thanksgiving menu, featuring a four-course tasting menu heavy on sustainable and regional ingredients. Their a la carte menu items will also be available. Address: 500 S. Dearborn St., Chicago Phone: 312-523-0200 Thanksgiving Hours: 3:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. Cost: Adults: $65; Children 2-12: $30
